professionalExperience.title: Director of Peabody Library / Director of Liaison & Instruction Services
duties: Manage operation of the Peabody Library and serve as primary University Library contact for faculty, staff, and students on the Peabody campus (depts include Human & Organizational Development; Leadership, Policy, & Organizations; Psychology & Human Development; Special Education; and Teaching & Learning).
Supervise 4 professional librarians and 3 full-time staff; spend and allocate library budgets; plan and implement library programming; determine and communicate library policies and procedures.

Provide leadership in the development and implementation of Vanderbilt University Libraries Liaison & Instruction Program, especially in the areas of teaching & learning; campus engagement; and research and reference services.
Lead campus-wide instructional efforts including information literacy assessment and undergraduate research initiatives such as Immersion.
Coordinate Ask a Librarian reference services, supervising task force of librarians triaging online research support.
Teach workshops on research tools, critical thinking, and research skills to undergraduates, graduate students, and university faculty and staff.

Plan, develop, and implement innovative programs for instruction and learning for faculty and students across the university, including use of educational technologies in library instruction, assessment of student learning, and supporting student research through embedded librarianship initiatives.
Mentor liaison librarians in the development of an entrepreneurial model for interaction with faculty and students in support of learning objectives across the university.
Participate in aligning library services and programs to the University Strategic Plan.

professionalExperience.title: Coordinator of Library Instruction & Assistant Professor
duties: Coordinated the University Libraries Instruction Program, including instructional design, assessment of student learning, integration of information literacy into the university curriculum, and providing training and support on instructional technologies for faculty librarians and staff.
Worked with faculty members and instructors to design research assignments and integrate information literacy, digital literacy, and critical thinking into their courses.
Promoted and marketed the University Libraries Instruction Program.
Lead assessment efforts for the Instruction Program, including the development of a rubric for assessing student learning and research skills in English Composition II.

Provided customized information literacy and research instruction (both course-related sessions & workshops), outreach, reference services, and collection development as liaison for the department of English, the School of Communication, and the School of Business, and other depts. as needed.
Offered specialized and general reference services in-person, on the phone, and virtually.

Designed information literacy learning objects for face-to-face, hybrid, and online education; created multi-media instructional tutorials mapped to student learning outcomes in 21st century competencies.
Worked with faculty to embed librarians and research tools in Blackboard and via social media.
Actively participated in acquisitions and collection development for multiple disciplines, meeting deadlines and managing budgets of near $10,000.
Supervised a library school student intern for approximately 10 hours per week in Spring 2013.
Participated in University Libraries strategic planning and annual goal setting initiatives.
Selected as Fellow for 2014-2015 Wichita State University Leadership Academy.

duties: Coordinated library instruction program; Led faculty librarians by assigning library instruction sessions and evaluated librarians’ teaching; Supervised information literacy initiative on campus; Taught majority of library instruction for campus; Planned library workshops; Coordinated & led training sessions for librarians and staff; Marketed and promoted information literacy to faculty; Prepared class handouts and library guides; Maintained statistics and evaluated library instruction program including instruction librarians; Staffed reference and circulation desks, co-supervising student assistants (approx. 10 hrs/wk); Answered email reference questions; Performed collection development for Education; LI Classes Taught: English, Business, Psychology, University Scholarship, Public Speaking, Journalism, Sociology, Social Work, Education; Successfully completed 3rd Year Review for Continuing Employment
